thread.section_title: New Jersey High School Sports Headlines
thread.title: Delaney to Have Hip Surgery

title: Delaney to Have Hip Surgery
text:
Delaney to Have Hip Surgery Press Release Special to NJHoops.com Related Links: Talk about it in NJHoops Hardwood Talk VILLANOVA, Pa. - Freshman forward Tim Delaney (Blair Academy - NJHoops #13 Class of 2015) will undergo hip surgery next week, it was announced today.Delaney, who has been on campus since enrolling in summer school in June, was diagnosed with a torn labrum in his left hip. The surgery will be performed by Dr. John Salvo."I'm disappointed for Tim," stated Wildcats' head coach Jay Wright. "Tim had a great summer and preseason. He's a very coachable young man and was picking up everything we do. The good news is that the doctors tell us this is an injury that can be fixed and we know Tim will be fully committed to his rehab."There is no present timetable for a return to the court for Delaney.NJ Hoops provides blanket coverage of NJ basketball all year long for the past 20 years and is proud to continue to be the NJ nominating source for the McDonald's All American game
